page.title: 14FARMING-4. A TENANT FARMER
page.content:
An example of a{tenant farm}is {Unthank Farm.}Mr Loadman runs this farm which is owned by the estate.The unusual name of the farm is of Danish origin from "Uthrop" or "Rustlers". This farm is on the low ground on both banks of the beck.
The farm covers{198 acres}and once again it is a mixed farm with arable crops and some livestock.
Several{crops}are grown on this farm,including,wheat,barley,oats,grass and oil seed rape which is sold by the tonne and used to make margarine.
There are also{cattle and sheep}kept on the farm.There is not a milking herd but 20 bullocks for beef which are a Charolais cross.There are 178 ewes on the farm (Mashams and Mules).
